meanings.definition: To crumple or crush into a small, irregular shape.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally scrumpled the paper while trying to fold it neatly.
meanings.sent2: Please do not scrumple the gift wrap; we need it to look presentable.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to scrumple the tissue paper for fun, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The old letter was scrumpled up in the attic, forgotten and abandoned.
meanings.sent5: The sound of scrumpling paper echoed through the empty room.

meanings.sent1: He tends to scrumple his shirt sleeves when he's nervous.
meanings.sent2: The fabric will scrumple if you don't fold it carefully after washing.
meanings.sent3: The wind made her hair scrumple into a wild tangle during the hike.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to scrumple and stretch as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The old map was scrumpled from years of being folded and unfolded.

meanings.sent1: She had to scrumple the clay to mold it into the desired shape.
meanings.sent2: The suitcase was so full that she had to scrumple her clothes to fit them in.
meanings.sent3: He tried to scrumple all his belongings into the tiny backpack.
meanings.sent4: The stress of the situation seemed to scrumple his thoughts into chaos.
meanings.sent5: The intense pressure caused the metal to scrumple into a twisted mess.
